articles.title: Famous Investor Suggests That Apple (AAPL) Is Not a Buy
articles.content: Stephanie Link, a frequent guest on CNBC, recently suggested during an appearance on the network that investors should not buy Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stock. Link is the Chief Investment Strategist at Hightower Advisors. Link: Why Would You Pay So Much for Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)? Referring to Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), Link rhetorically asked, “Why would you […]

articles.title: Meta’s Future Lies With Judge as FTC Antitrust Trial Ends
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Meta Platforms Inc. has done all it can in court to fight back at the US Federal Trade Commission’s claims that it’s a monopoly. Now it’s up to a federal judge to decide whether the company should be broken up.Most Read from BloombergUAE’s AI University Aims to Become Stanford of the GulfNY Wins Order Against US Funding Freeze in Congestion FightThe seven-week trial wrapped up Tuesday, and now each side has four months to make its case in writing. Then US District Judge James Boas

articles.title: iPhone Tariff Threat Weighs on Apple
articles.content: It's a "fairytale" to think the full iPhone supply chain can be moved to the U.S., says Carolina Milanesi, president and principal analyst at Creative Strategies. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Technology."

articles.title: Expectations For Apple's WWDC Couldn't Be Lower
articles.content: Expectations for Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference are subdued this year. And that sentiment is reflected in Apple stock.

articles.title: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Apple, Tesla, DJT, Informatica, Super Micro, PDD, SoundHound, and More
articles.content: Apple rises after tumbling Friday when President Donald Trump threatened a 25% tariff on iPhones sold in the U.S. that are made overseas, while Tesla trades higher even as the electric-vehicle maker’s sales in Europe decline for a fourth straight month.

articles.title: EU Crisis Averted. Same Time Next Week?
articles.content: Wall Street sprinted back from last weekâs slump on Tuesday, fueled by Trumpâs trade policy spin cycle, a jolt in consumer confidence, and falling bond yields.

articles.title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq soar as Trump pauses EU tariff hikes for fast-tracked talks
articles.content: Optimism for a US-EU trade deal is growing as talks speed up after Trump's delay to 50% tariffs.

articles.title: Apple to Debut Dedicated Gaming App Within Days of Switch 2’s Arrival
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. is planning a dedicated app for video games on its devices, seeking to sell gamers and developers on the idea that it’s a leader in the market.Most Read from BloombergUAE’s AI University Aims to Become Stanford of the GulfNY Wins Order Against US Funding Freeze in Congestion FightThe company will preinstall the app on the iPhone, iPad, Mac and Apple TV set-top box later this year, according to people with knowledge of the matter. articles.title: Citi Reiterates Buy Rating on Apple (AAPL), Keeps PT at $240
articles.content: On May 27, Citi reiterated its Buy rating on Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), keeping its price target of $240 for the stock. Atif Malik from Citi maintains his rating on Apple, as he sees President Trump’s announcement of 25% tariffs on Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) to have a limited impact on the company’s business. articles.title: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Apple, Tesla, DJT, Informatica, Super Micro, PDD, SoundHound, and More
articles.content: Apple rises after tumbling Friday when President Donald Trump threatened a 25% tariff on iPhones sold in the U.S. that are made overseas, while Tesla trades higher even as the electric-vehicle maker’s sales in Europe decline for a fourth straight month.
